original_response:
If Sarah does 400 pounds of laundry, and Raymond does half as much laundry as Sarah, then Raymond does 400 / 2 = 200 pounds of laundry.
If Sarah does 4 times as much laundry as David, then David does 400 / 4 = 100 pounds of laundry.
The difference in the amount of laundry Raymond and David do is 200 - 100 = 100 pounds.
The answer is 100.

original_response: Si Sarah lava 400 libras de ropa, entonces Raymond lava 1/2 * 400 = 200 libras de ropa. Si Sarah lava 4 veces más ropa que David, entonces David lava 400/4 = 100 libras de ropa. La diferencia en la cantidad de ropa que lavan Raymond y David es 200 - 100 = 100 libras. La respuesta es 100.

original_response: Si Sara fait 400 livres de lessive, alors Raymond fait 400/2 = 200 livres de lessive. Et si Sara fait 4 fois plus de lessive que David, alors David fait 400/4 = 100 livres de lessive. La différence entre la quantité de lessive que Raymond et David effectuent est de 200 à 100 = 100 livres. La réponse est 100.

original_response: Ikiwa Sarah anafua pauni 400 za nguo, David anafua 1/4 * 400 = pauni 100 za nguo. Ikiwa Raymond atafua nusu ya kiwango ambacho Sarah anafua, basi anafua 1/2 * 400 = pauni 200 za nguo. Tofauti katika kiasi cha nguo ambazo Raymond na David hufua ni 200 - 100 = 100
